reviews.review_msg: no more than one unmarketable tomato ahh prof
the second she opened her mouth, I knew this class was cooked.

Rather have prof that doesn't teach well but gives easy exams than teaches fine but gives bad exams. It was not hard to do well people just expect to be coddled. But there was no catch on the exams and she did scale up. Just learn material independently and understand assignment questions.

i don't even know where to begin. Sent 10+ emails and she responsed with "to.9 tird t respond stop send mails"  (I copied and pasted her email here no joke). rude. careless. lazy. idek how sfu approved this prof to teach. you ask her " how do you simplify this?" she says " yes simplify" ?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!? idek bro GL if you have this prof

Why would you be required to score at least 50% on the lab and 50% on the test to pass the course? The course is already difficult enough, and the labs are time-consuming. Avoid this professor because she yaps and makes many strict rules for assignments and labs.

Sometimes they go on explaining things (rambling) but examples are probably the way to go in understand. REALLY fair exams cuz its all from homework or extra problem sets. Communication with the prof is a bit hard but once you get what shes saying its easy to follow along esp cuz she repeats herself a lot.

Fair marker and very lenient with assignments and deadlines. Nothing's a surprise on tests and she is very much available via email, doesn't take long to respond. The course itself is pretty tough that's why many people might blame the prof but you just have to put in the work yourself. VHDL was hard to learn but in eng no prof is good for coding.

I actually despise this professor so much, she made me fail out of engineering :(. Now I am in business, which is SO much better because I can actually UNDERSTAND the professors there. PLEASE AVOID HER!!!!
Cannot understand a work she says during lectures. She insists us to ask questions if we don't understand and people try but she doesn't answer them. Shows up late a lot too.
supposed to be very interesting and engaging class with majid :( should've taken it in summer
nobody can understand what she's trying to say

Get ready to not understand a single word in her class. She got the lectures from a previous prof, and just showed up to class, and endeavored to improvise. Extremely awful. You ask her a question, she answers something else. Just read on your own, the course is mainly logic so you can do fine.
